page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO BERE FERRERS
page.content: The leader of this{Domesday Project group had her introduction to{Bere {Ferrers}peninsula,when a lane she had been travelling along to get there, turned into a rocky, pit-holed track with no space to turn and with marshland on one side and scrubland on the other.The signpost gave no indication that this would happen. There are better means of vehicular access, but this peninsula,almost entirely surrounded by water is best approached by train. Carried high over viaducts, rocking along by the Tamar and speeding through fertile pastures one gains a truer impression. "Bere"is Celtic for peninsula or spit of land and Ferrers is named after the Ferrers family. Sir Henry de Ferrers was Chairman of the original Domesday Commission! Bere Ferrers is mentioned in Domesday as "Birlanda" .
